text: hi guys it salutes from my Copic
addiction and in today's episode I'm
gonna be showing you how to make this
gorgeous really really simple giant
cupcake covered in rainbows of M&Ms and
filled with Nutella this is one of my
absolute favorite giant cupcakes today I
love rainbow I love M&Ms I love Nutella
let's get started the things you'll need
for today's tutorial firstly you don't
need a giant cupcake so I've got that
all baked and ready to go as for a giant
cupcake basic series I will link to that
in the description box below and you can
use your favorite chocolate cupcake

link to in the description box below
I've got a bread knife and I've also got
some rainbow ribbon I just grabbed this
on eBay I love that it gives you that
kind of rainbow look to the base to
match in with the top of your cupcake of
course we have M&Ms so I've pre
separated these all into their
individual colors and I've used about
two large sized bags of M&Ms I've also
got a spatula and offset spatula a large
jar of Nutella some melted green candy
melt so you can color your own chocolate
and the base of my silicon giant cupcake
case first up we're going to start on a
giant cupcake case so you can make this
any color you like I opted for green
today I'm just pouring in about half of
those candy melts and I'm scraping them
up the sides of my giant cupcake
keyspace and then spreading them out you
want two thin coats here rather than one
set coat because it's going to give you
a better base pop that one into the
fridge to set and then you want to take
a giant cupcake and your bread knife and
you're just going to trim off the bottom
of your top section and then around the
sides of your bottom section now your
giant cupcakes should be cooked and
completely cooled so that it doesn't
crumble when you cut it with that base
you didn't want to just carve a nice
flat top off the very very top and then
cut the base in half so you've got your
little three layers happening there your
first coat of that giant chocolate base
should be dry so you can see how I'm
just using my spatula just to apply a
second coat all the way around that
giant cupcake case and back off into the
fridge when it comes out you're going to
have a really strong solid base for your
cupcakes you can see I'm just peeling
around the edges loosening those edges
off
first and then your giant cupcake base
should just pop out I always like to
rest it back into the cupcake case for
extra stability and then I'm going to
take my offset spatula and we're going
to scoop a generous amount of Nutella
just to coat the inside of that face
before taking the bottom section of the
cake and pushing it right in that
Nutella just gives it something to stick
to
now we're going to use the teller as our
frosting today to save you guys having
to make your own frosting and because
Nutella is utterly delicious so once
again I'm just scooping a nice layer of
Nutella in and then popping in my second
layer of cake or my center layer of cake
with this one you do want to make sure
that you're getting on a tower all the
way around to the edges and making it as
flat and as smooth as you can on the top
before applying your very very top
section or your cone of your giant
cupcake you can see using the offset
spatula once again I'm just kind of
applying a really messy coat of that
Nutella and then you can smooth it out a
little bit on your final coat this is
going to be what your M&Ms stick to the
reason I hope did for Nutella here is
because it doesn't crust and dry quite
as quick as a buttercream so it gives
you more time to position your M&Ms just
perfectly on top spoon a little melted
green candy melt into the center of your
cake board and then very very carefully
roll down the sides of your silicone
cupcake case being careful not to get
your base dirty before lifting it out
gently and sticking it down that melted
shop that's actually going to be there
to hold it in place and stop your cake
from moving around during transportation
now it's time for the fun part so you
want to position your M&Ms here and you
want them on their sides kind of flat
against the top of that chocolate
cupcake case because that's what's going
to hold them in place I love the color
scheme of red orange yellow green blue
and then brown I just think it suits but
obviously you can use any color scheme
you like here for your second row you
want to kind of keep that color scheme
the same but you just want to stand the
M&Ms up sort of on their ends pushing
them in so you've got a little bit of
texture and a little bit of variation in
the positioning of your M&Ms every now
and again you just want to use your
fingers just to push all of your M&Ms in
together so there's sort of nice and
neat and your little rose or as even as
they can be once you finish that second
row we're going to go back to another
row of our laying down M&Ms and then
you're going to do another row of your
standing up M&Ms with some laying down
M&Ms on top repeating that process all
the way to the top of a giant cupcake
this is possibly one of the easiest and
most effective giant cupcake designs
that we've done it's really versatile
can go for boy
girls rainbow parties unicorn parties
absolutely gorgeous and it's a
combination of M&Ms and Nutella two of

would like that ribbon you can choose
your base color this cake is really
